Author: Vertigo#0439
Content: ü§î

Author: yorklab#7270
Content: If you are using the Lite wallet (recommended), when you first load Agama it will ask you for a seed, or it can create one for you. That's your Key. Keep it safe, its the only way  to get to your funds. Copy the address, log out, then log  back in to make sure you see the exact same address, then you know you retyped (or pasted) the correct seed. You should send 1 kmd to the wallet first to make sure you can access it again. If you see the kmd you sent, then you should be good.

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: Vertigo already answered in #deleted-channel  if you need more information let me know through PM and I will come back to see your message on the channel ,   I will be out of desk for a while , if you were asking about encryption of the wallet.dat file in native mode , this is not possible due to Zcash standards https://github.com/zcash/zcash/blob/master/doc/security-warnings.md , Komodo being a fork of zcash has this same standard. But still you could encrypt your wallet with a password in a separate folder or cold storage if needed each time you do an important transaction.

Content: hello my wallet is stuck at block 952476

Content: it says 0 connections, what can i do?

Content: i did a dnat tcp port of 7770

Author: dokrates#8987
Content: but i still haven't connections

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Hello @dokrates Which Agama version are you using and on which platform?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: @dokrates Please try to close Agama, stop all komodod processes (via task manager or by PC reboot). Then delete  %appdata%/Komodo/peers.dat and try again

Author: dokrates#8987
Content: done

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Do you have any connections now?

Author: dokrates#8987
Content: now 1

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Already better than 0 üòÉ  Are blocks continued to sync?

Author: dokrates#8987
Content: still at 952476

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Wait a little bit - probably it's re-indexing existing blocks atm

Author: dokrates#8987
Content: show now connections 0

Author: dokrates#8987
Content: could you provide me komodo.conf?

Author: dokrates#8987
Content: because i modified it

Author: dokrates#8987
Content: because i saw all addnode belong to same line

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
```rpcuser=youruser
rpcpassword=yourpassword
server=1
rpcport=7771
addnode=78.47.196.146
addnode=5.9.102.210
addnode=178.63.69.164
addnode=88.198.65.74
addnode=5.9.122.241```

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Should be something like that

Author: dokrates#8987
Content: yes, it is

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
`i did a dnat tcp port of 7770`
Did you set 7770 in your config as well? 
If `komodo-cli getinfo` return no error it should be a connectivity error

Author: dokrates#8987
Content: you mean this should be rpcport=7770 ?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: No 7771 in config is ok, I just not sure why you opened 7770 port

Author: dokrates#8987
Content: so, what port i must open?

Author: dokrates#8987
Content: to improve connections

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: As I know for external connections komodod taking random ports, ports 7770 and 7701 listening on localhost for local RPC calls

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Not sure how to make it on Windows but you just have to allow external connections for Agama by your firewall if you have strict network rules in your network

Author: dokrates#8987
Content: my host is running on private network

Author: dokrates#8987
Content: no firewall on the host

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: For example komodod on linux - two localhost listeners on 7770 and 7771 and 6 external connections to nodes for syncing

Author: dokrates#8987
Content: i must perform any dnat port?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: I'm not sure about your network/security configuration - just connections for Agama shouldn't be blocked by AV/Firewall

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: These connections taking ports in range 30000-60000 as I know

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Try to allow all in network rules for start and check if it helps

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: If you used a pin to enter the wallet then you had a seed passphrase that you should have wrote when you first created the wallet.

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: If you used the native version of the wallet. The wallet.dat file had your private keys stored natively in your computer. You should had a copy of this file or a copy of the  of the address private keys that hold your funds.

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: You can be as careful or careless with your wallet, this is why we made a pin option to the lite mode version of the wallet and had all the disclaimers warning new users to write down their seed because that's basically your private keys.

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: I hope we could help more but basically if you don't have the wallet.dat , seed or private keys there is not much that we can help with

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: If you by any chance get back the data from your hard drive , it could be the only way that I see that you could solve the problem...
